intro: Sida subracemosa, commonly known as the slender sida, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in racemose inflorescences, which are clusters of flowers along a central stem. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape, with serrated edges, and the plant has a hairy texture. Sida subracemosa is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical environments.
